article:
In Biomaterials Testing, a 'cell culture assay' is any method which is used to
assess the cytotoxicity of a material. This refers to the [[in vitro]]
assessment of material to determine whether it releases toxic chemicals in
sufficient quantities to kill cells either directly or indirectly through the
inhibition of cell metabolic pathways. Cell culture evaluations are the
precursor to whole animal studies and are a way to determine if significant
cytotoxicity exists for the given material. Cell culture assays are standardized
by ASTM, ISO, and BSI (British Standards Institution.)
